@dioceseoflondon Having the chance to attend a service at St. Paul's in 2012 and have communion was very, very special for me.
@dioceseoflondon Ha ha. Only if you have a private jet at the airport here to make it by morning. I'll be thinking of you all though. Enjoy.
@dioceseoflondon Worked in London after becoming a nurse in Vancouver years ago (am retired now) & worked at Great Ormond St. Hospital.
@raiderhater719 Seems to me you are anti everything that's decent about being a caring human being - such a sad way to live a life.
@dioceseoflondon Thank you for the invitation but am in Vancouver, Canada where living. Have visited England often since immigrating age 6.

@DavidBflower Think actually wanted to be an astronaut when a teen. Always read Life magazines with in depth articles about US astronauts.

@DavidBflower I've been interested in astronauts since teens. Visited Ca. Science Center in 2012 & saw the Challenger. Met @ChrisHadfield.
@DavidBflower I don't recall this happening. The information is staggering. Heartening the memorials, honours bestowed on each astronaut.

@CTVNews Outside a Metro Vancouver Mosque were numerous flowers & notes when dropping off my plant of mini-daffodils and card. Nice to see.
@nancystaack Thought it would also be a way for you to feel hopeful about something. May arrive mid-next week.

Spoke to a younger, married Muslim at the Mosque about events in Que. & said his wife is nervous go to out. Should not be in our Canada.

@tcromwell1 Yes, but this is nothing new at all. He prob. learned to lie well in order to survive his childhood with an domineering father.
@tcromwell1 Example: A company states has a 51% product success BUT if only 10% of those with complaint contact company, statistic is wrong.
@tcromwell1 Statistics can be put 'out there' but unless one REALLY looks at the numbers carefully, then a mis-perception of fact happens.
@tcromwell1 As I've now explained, it's not half of the US supportive; but a much higher % who didn't even vote of US population.
